first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles
first_reading.text:
[[Ac 8,1b]]There broke out a severe persecution of the Church in Jerusalem, and all were scattered throughout the countryside of Judea and Samaria, except the Apostles.
[[Ac 8,2]]Devout men buried Stephen and made a loud lament over him.
[[Ac 8,3]]Saul, meanwhile, was trying to destroy the church; entering house after house and dragging out men and women, he handed them over for imprisonment.
[[Ac 8,4]]Now those who had been scattered went about preaching the word.
[[Ac 8,5]]Thus Philip went down to (the) city of Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah to them.
[[Ac 8,6]]With one accord, the crowds paid attention to what was said by Philip when they heard it and saw the signs he was doing.
[[Ac 8,7]]For unclean spirits, crying out in a loud voice, came out of many possessed people, and many paralyzed and crippled people were cured.
[[Ac 8,8]]There was great joy in that city.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 6,35]]Jesus said to the crowds,  "I am the bread of life;  whoever comes to me will never hunger,  and whoever believes in me will never thirst.
[[Jn 6,36]]But I told you that although you have seen (me), you do not believe.
[[Jn 6,37]]Everything that the Father gives me will come to me, and I will not reject anyone who comes to me,
[[Jn 6,38]]because I came down from heaven not to do my own will but the will of the one who sent me.
[[Jn 6,39]]And this is the will of the one who sent me, that I should not lose anything of what he gave me, but that I should raise it on the last day.
[[Jn 6,40]]For this is the will of my Father, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in him may have eternal life, and I shall raise him on the last day."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 66,1]]Shout joyfully to God, all the earth,
[[Ps 66,2]]sing praise to the glory of his name; 
proclaim his glorious praise.
[[Ps 66,3a]]Say to God, “How tremendous are your deeds!”

[[Ps 66,4]]“Let all on earth worship and sing praise to you, 
sing praise to your name!”
[[Ps 66,5]]Come and see the works of God, 
his tremendous deeds among the children of Adam.

[[Ps 66,6]]He has changed the sea into dry land; 
through the river they passed on foot; 
therefore let us rejoice in him.
[[Ps 66,7a]]He rules by his might forever.
